questions.text: Which is a type of billiard game?
questions.explanation:
snooker.

	It is played with 15 red balls and 6 balls of assorted colors.

questions.text: All of the following are a type of container save one. Which one is not a type of container?
questions.explanation:
croupier.

	A croupier is one who collects and pays bets at a gambling table. A hogshead is a large barrel. A flask is a glass container and a demijohn is a large narrow-necked bottle usually enclosed in wicker.

questions.correct: The loose skin under the necks of cattle
options: The visible frost caused by the condensation of vapor
questions.explanation: The loose skin under the necks of cattle.

questions.text: All of the following are a type of apparel except one. Which one is not something a person would wear?
questions.explanation:
buteo.

	A fedora is a type of hat. A cravat is a necktie and knickers are short loose fitting pants (in the UK, they refer to ladies' underwear). A buteo is a type of hawk.

questions.text: Which of these words has something to do with trains?
questions.explanation:
railhead.

	Raillery is good-natured teasing. A railbird is someone who sits on a fence near a race track. A railroad worm is a fruit fly's larva. Railhead is a section on the railroad where train traffic may start.

questions.text: All of these words can mean 'to make up in order to deceive' except one. Which one does not have that meaning?
questions.explanation:
meliorate.

	Meliorate means to cause to improve or to make better.

questions.text: How would you spell the little gnome or elf you would find, according to Irish folklore, at the end of the rainbow?
Which of these words would be defined as 'the art of interpreting the Bible'?
questions.explanation:
hermeneutics.

	Homiletics is the study of sermon delivery. Bibliotics is the study of handwriting. Revelatics is not a word.

questions.correct: An excessive desire for material gain
options: The angle of an archer's aim
A strong desire to be introduced to someone
The excessive desire for an intimate relationship
questions.explanation: An excessive desire for material gain.

questions.text: If you were to rig a sail on a boat you would stick the rope through a _______. What goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
grommet.

	A gromwell is a type of plant. A grog is a drink, usually rum mixed with water. A grouper is a type of fish. Hope you enjoyed this quiz.
